object.name: ChatJoinRequest
object.description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.
object.html_description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.
object.rst_description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

annotations.description: Chat to which the request was sent
annotations.html_description: Chat to which the request was sent
annotations.rst_description: Chat to which the request was sent
annotations.name: chat

annotations.description: User that sent the join request
annotations.rst_description: User that sent the join request
annotations.name: from

annotations.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.
annotations.html_description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.
annotations.rst_description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.
annotations.name: user_chat_id

annotations.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time
annotations.html_description: Date the request was sent in Unix time
annotations.rst_description: Date the request was sent in Unix time
annotations.name: date

annotations.description: Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request
annotations.html_description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request
annotations.name: invite_link
